messages.content: Well, do you think that demonic form is bad, even if it is udgrade?
I'd say yes, it's very slow in nature, and Ironclad's strength builds usually have faster scaling than that.

I think it is usually pretty bad
- Horrendous in act 1: very slow and you never have enough energy
- Horrendous for act 2: every monster will kill you in two turn if you can't deal with them and it doesn't help at all
- Good if your deck has issues against big slow monsters (Giant head, Champ, etc) but you need to draw it fast and with Ironclad, you're usually way stronger than you think
- OK with snecko cause big impact if it doesn't cost 3 energy
- Upgrade doesn't do much, one strength every turn isn't that much a difference if you're already getting 2 a turn
- Pretty meh compared to other Ironclad rares

I would take it if the champ fight scares me and I want one card to deal with it, but if champ doesn't scare you you have no need for it
it is very mediocre
for most of the reasons outlined before
however, the upgrade is a x1.5 to its power
and it can provide all the scaling you ever need
I personally take it if I am in desperate need of scaling
Demon form is that card you take if you have no real way to beat the champ
It’s 3 cost for theoretically infinite strength scaling that only gives 2(3) a turn
If you were to have a snecko eye or at least some way to cheapen and duplicate it like dual wield + mummified hand it can be playable

But when cards like rupture exists, which does the same thing but synergizes well with other good early and lategame pickups like hemokinesis and offering, when are you realistically ever taking this card

That said I find it funny and I like funny cards
XD
Thank you for the coments
:cat_hermit:
:awaken:
Guys, what do you think if the demonic form At the beginning of each turn doubled your strength? would it be too broken?

I was going to respond to the original question - it is generally difficult to use, but it does have uses. It's really strong if you can play it, so you have to find ways to work around the 3 energy cost and waiting for the strength to come in. Usually that's when you have a decent amount of Block or healing.

I think a great way to look at every card in the game is to ask if you can work around the card's downsides, and if the upsides are worth it if you can. Every card has a time and place where it's useful, so keeping your eyes open for those opportunities will help you win. Also it's fun to figure out that something that usually doesn't work might actually work in your situation.
So.... Is it alright like this?
also "play a <limit break> at the start of each turn" would be insanely busted

embeds.title: Limit Break
embeds.description:
Rare Skill / 1 :red_energy: / The Ironclad / Slay the Spire

Double your **Strength** :p_strength:.
​~~- **Exhaust**. -~~

messages.content: i don't know if it's good enough right now, but it's not the worst card
also i think the double-strength idea has a big weakness - it does nothing if you have no other sources of strength
meanwhile the current version can be played with 0 strength and be useful
and you really only need 8 strength to win a fight, maybe a little more with a defensive deck like demon form wants you to have
Well, that's the idea, since the current one is not that useful, because it is a slow play, that this at least makes it a better play for your other cards with a source of strength
it just seemed like the condition for it being good changed instead of making it stronger
that's just my opinion though
Well, the other option, more bland in my opinion, is that of 4 strength without improving, improved... 5 strength? 6 seems like a lot...
I think it's fine, not every card needs to be top tier
and this can be a scaling engine going into some fights if you have none.
ok
yeah
demon form does what it needs to do
and it does it decently
and as for being bad in act 1: aren't most 3 cost powers bad in act 1???
yes, with the rare exception of...
# CONSTRUCTION FORM
and wraith form
wraith form pretty hard to use in act 1
how you gonna finish a fight with strikes and no bonus damage
By taking bonus damage. If you're just using strikes that's not gonna work. Act 1 is about getting solid offense/defense quick.
it is difficult to find enough though, and you do have to survive the first few floors with another weak card
idk no matter what floor I see it on, I usually click the funny intangible button
And also notice that the 2 powers we named are also just 2 extremely good powers.
I think that Demonic form wasn't designed as much for strength builds, because these builds are fast, they don't last that many turns... which build does this card fit best in currently?
strength is just a way to help you handle the stronger enemies in the game
a defensive build with a couple of really efficient strength multipliers can still win, like and
In the long run, two boomerang swords are better than one improved heavy sword, against a single target.
Yes but as you said, against a single target. In multiple enemy fights (especially shapes with a thorns guy) it is worse, and even in single enemy fights it takes up 2 card draws instead of 1.
They both have their merit.
Right, still, I saw that two airon clad tier list videos put the heavy sword on a lower top than the boomerang sword.
there is also <necronomicon>
and <Snecko Eye>

embeds.title: Necronomicon
embeds.description:
Special Relic / All / Slay the Spire

The first Attack played each turn that costs 2 or more is played twice. Upon pickup, obtain a special **Curse**.
*Only a fool would try and harness this evil power. At night your dreams are haunted by images of the book devouring your mind.*

embeds.title: Snecko Eye
embeds.description:
Boss Relic / All / Slay the Spire

At the start of your turn, draw 2 additional cards. Start each combat **Confused**.
*An eye of a fallen snecko. Much larger than you imagined.*

messages.content: both of which heavily favour the heavy blade
I would do the same, but there is a use case for each of them.
also tier lists are generally not very useful for this game
they generally end up providing a better view within the mind of the tier list maker than actually providing advice
Unless you play at the top level, they hold very little weight too.
Yeah just pure play style differences can change so much. Both Evab and I are A20 Guardian players, but when they posted their tier list I changed over 1/3 of the cards and what tier they were in.
and me as well
Yeah you probably put ancient construct out of D tier
when I posted my tier list it was wildly different from either Nic200's or Evab's
Yes, I did
You shouldn't've
multi-contractions
interesting
I'd say D tier. Stasis lets it get into play easier than it would on other characters, and it can be useful as a worse demon form that can hit dex.
They're fun to do
ok

:awaken_sans:

i don't think it's a good idea to think about "builds", but think about what the deck is lacking 
is your deck only source of damage strikes? if yes, firstly, how did you fuck up that bad lol? secondly, yes demon form might be a good way to make the strikes win you boss fights
the card suits decks that lack in slow scaling, but it is often overvalued cause you dont need infinite strength, you often need 8 strength and good attacks for every boss fight cause ironclad hit hard
so, I should never choose demonic force for any deck, not even a slow one, right?
uhhhhhhhh
like in real life, statements with "never" or "always" and synonyms of those words
are rarely correct
demon form is still scaling
and sometimes you just don't find any scaling
and then demon form shows up and (admittedly slowly) solves all your scaling needs
Yeah I don't think there is any card in the game would "never take". The situations may be very niche for some cards, but they all serve a purpose.
And slow scaling is better than no scaling.
Except for the hits and defenders that come by default, any card of the same level that does not run out overcomes them, but hey, they are designed for
Although the defenders with the silent, they are useful if you have the power that increases your dexterity
Well yeah strikes and defends aren't supposed to be good
and even then there is hermit with strike builds which are bad, but technically it's not horrible
ah
Yes, the hermit.....
I was just pointing out the one situation where a strike might not be horrible
It's still pretty bad though

Thank you
